pullRequest.body:
In this PR, 
1. we generalize the definition of the pretilt and
2. define the untilt function from the pretilt of a p-adically complete ring to the ring itself.

The results about pretilt and tilt are kept unchanged as much as possible. They will be generalized in future PRs.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [9052e95d07](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21563/commits/9052e95d079faf5a64615cfe3a8c72d3dc080b37)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Perfectoid.Untilt` (new file)|1839|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsHausdorff.eq_iff_smodEq`
`+ _root_.sub_smodEq_zero`
`+ exists_smodEq_untiltAux`
`+ instance : CharP (PreTilt O p) p`
`+ instance : CommRing (PreTilt O p)`
`+ instance [Fact p.Prime] [hvp : Fact (v p ≠ 1)] : Field (Tilt K v O hv p)`
`+ isDomain`
`+ mk_comp_untilt_eq_coeff_zero`
`+ mk_out`
`+ mk_untilt_eq_coeff_zero`
`+ nontrivial`
`+ pow_dvd_mul_untiltAux_sub_untiltAux_mul`
`+ pow_dvd_one_untiltAux_sub_one`
`+ pow_dvd_untiltAux_sub_untiltAux`
`+ untilt`
`+ untiltAux`
`+ untiltAux_smodEq_untiltFun`
`+ untiltFun`
`- instance : CharP (PreTilt K v O hv p) p`
`- instance : CommRing (PreTilt K v O hv p)`
`- instance [Fact p.Prime] [Fact (v p ≠ 1)] : Field (Tilt K v O hv p)`
`- instance [hp : Fact p.Prime] : IsDomain (PreTilt K v O hv p) := by`
`- instance [hp : Fact p.Prime] [Fact (v p ≠ 1)] : Nontrivial (ModP K v O hv p)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (3.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|3363|-3|porting notes|

Current commit [9052e95d07](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/9052e95d079faf5a64615cfe3a8c72d3dc080b37)
Reference commit [c3c9f71b3b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/c3c9f71b3b6b7e4f64de61df4f2d2f1e456a630b)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: jjdishere can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13433076758/job/37529108203)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13433076758/job/37529107795)

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```
Can you switch the LHS with the RHS? The name seems to suggest this direction.
Thank you for the suggestion! Fixed.
Does `simpa using h` work here? The guideline is not to squeeze if not necessary.
I don't think `simpa using h` works here since `SModEq.sub_mem` is not tagged with `@[simp]`. But `simpa [SModEq.sub_mem] using h` works. I'll do this.
This looks like an improvement to me, but do you know what was the reason for the previous definition?
I'm not sure what the concrete reason is here. All the following sections share the same variables here.

```suggestion
variable {O : Type*} [CommRing O] {p : ℕ} [Fact (Nat.Prime p)] [Fact ¬IsUnit (p : O)]
```

```suggestion
  | 0 => 1
  | n + 1 =>
```
looks nicer.

```suggestion
    refine (dvd_sub_pow_of_dvd_sub ?_ m)
```
Nonterminal `simp`.
Sorry. Fixed!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Perfectoid): define the untilt map and generalize pretilt
